alert.note: Alert for Furnas; Harlan (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 04 at 6:59PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Furnas and northwestern Harlan Counties through 730 PM CDT... At 659 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Oxford, or 18 miles southwest of Holdrege, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Furnas and northwestern Harlan Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
